channel.title: You Are Allowed to Enjoy This...The PODCAST!
channel.description: The irregular podcasts of Darren Lock, a internet musician based in the UK. These broadcasts features the techniques I use to record songs using a home PC and Sonar and my creative process. This feed also includes some demo mixes of music I am currently recording.

item.title: Prog Review 15: Discipline 40th Anniversary Edition - King Crimson
item.description:
You can watch the review on YouTube at:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cy-Rxabfow

The new 40th anniversary edition of this album arrived yesterday and so I busied myself to prepare a review for you. This is a very tiring record to listen to as you have to divide your attention between all the guitar parts.

Don't forget to give this video a thumbs up if you like it and to subscribe for future updates.

Music used in this video:

"Stinkhorn" by Darren Lock

item.title: Prog Review 13: Starless & Bible Black 40th Anniversary Edition - King Crimson
item.description:
You can watch the review on YouTube at:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nElY_6avRQg

The latest batch of King Crimson 40th Anniversary edition have been released and my copy of "Starless and Bible Black" arrived today. I was naturally keen to hear what they had done to the album with regards to the 5.1 surround sound mix and was pleasantly surprised by the renewed power of the album.

item.title: 09-07-11 [Looking Glass]
item.description:
I am registered with a website called "Sentric Music" and this site supposedly finds music for adverts and whatever promotional contracts it is handling. They often send out emails requesting a certain type of song for a project and usually it is some kind of indie-rock genre that I am not interesting in covering. However, last Friday they sent a brief out for an advert for a mobile phone company and wanted something suitably twee and spacey. This is my attempt at a track for them. I doubt it will get picked but this was recorded specifically for a mobile phone advert. So there you go...

http://www.darrenlock.com/media/looking_glass.mp3
item.itunes:author: Darren Lock
item.itunes:subtitle: This is a track I recorded for a mobile phone advert brief (but I doubt it will get picked).

item.title: 24-06-11 Podcast - Chapter One of Dead Rock Star
item.description:
And now for something completely different...

This is me reading the first chapter of my novel "Dead Rock Star". I've never done this before, so please excuse the bits where I flub things up and get a little off-kilter.

This novel is now available to purchase in eBook format (Kindle compatible) at the following online stores at a unfeasibly low, low introductory price:

http://www.lulu.com/product/ebook/dead-rock-star/16116045

Amazon US:
http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0057H6XC0

Amazon UK:
https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B0057H6XC0

And coming soon to iBookstore!

If you like it, drop me a comment on my website www.darrenlock.com and I'll record the second chapter (not sure if that's more of a threat than a treat).

item.title: 29-05-11 [Rough Sketch]
item.description:
This is a rough idea I put down recently. I haven't done any serious recording for about five months, so whenever I return to active recording duty I always just mess around playing the simplest things just so I can get my fingers back into some sort of shape. Hence this song is as basic as it gets - however, good songs sometimes come from these basic frameworks.

This recording also marks my debut recording using my iMac DAW and was put down using Logic Studio.
item.itunes:author: Darren Lock
item.itunes:subtitle:

item.title: Frog and Toad [2010 Version]
item.description:
This track was originally recorded in 2005 and appeared on my 2006 compilation "God Pays Debts Without Money" - look it up it is rather good. I thought this little tune deserved more exposure so here it is with me desperately trying to remember the lead line after not playing it for a good few years.
You can buy the "God Pays Debts Without Money" boxset from here: http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/darrenlock4
Or you can download the lot from iTunes: http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/god-pays-debts-without-money/id203957350

item.title: Forever Autumn [2010 Version]
item.description:
I was looking through some of my old videos and thought it be nice to "update" some of them using my new webcam and the ability to upload HD video files to YouTube.
This is one of my popular tracks "Forever Autumn" which has absolutely nothing to do with the song with Justin Hayward from "War of the Worlds". The fact that they share the same name is purely coincidental.
This is from the album "Without Words", which can be purchased from here: http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/darrenlock2
Or if you have iTunes, here: http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/without-words/id18757324
And if you want to download the whole album for FREE in superb 5.1 surround sound glory, you can get that direct from my website here: http://www.darrenlock.com/mt/archives/dvd-downloads/
item.author: mail@darrenlock.com
item.source: You Are Allowed to Enjoy This...The PODCAST!

item.title: 28-09-10 Podcast "Bad Cover Version" Special
item.description: In this podcast, Darren talks about his "Bad Cover Version" project in which he does his best to record really awful renditions of popular favourites. Tracks include "Heroes" by David Bowie, "The Bucket" by Kings of Leon, "Who Knows Where the Time Goes?" by Fairport Convention, "Are Friends Electric?" by Tubeway Army, "Something to Do" by Adrian Belew, "Sabotage" by The Beastie Boys, "Willow's Song" from The Wicker Man movie, "King's Lead Hat" by Brian Eno, "Wannabe" by The Spice Girls, "Girl Like You" by Edwyn Collins, "Lucky Man" by The Verve, "Love Will Tear Us Apart" by Joy Division and "Sunrise" by Pulp.
item.author: mail@darrenlock.com
item.source: You Are Allowed to Enjoy This...The PODCAST!
item.itunes:author: Darren Lock

item.title: 30-06-10 Ambient Collaboration with Anthony Bloxham
item.description: Via the wonder web and YouTube, Anthony Bloxham contacted me regarding a possible collaboration. As someone who has no qualms with getting his feet wet and doing the fandango with complete strangers, I said "Yes!" Anthony Bloxham sent me a backing track this afternoon which seemed to consist of a drone, some birdsong, ambient outdoor noises and thunderstorms. Of course, I didn't know this until the piece had ended as I just strapped on my guitar, loaded his track into Sonar and pressed "Record". And so this is my attempt at doing something very live and improvised with a complete stranger. I'll let you all decide whether or not it is a success or not!
item.author: mail@darrenlock.com
item.source: You Are Allowed to Enjoy This...The PODCAST!

item.title: Age of Communication - 03 August 2006
item.description: This is a vocal track I recorded for a CD boxset I am working on. This is a rough mix with a guide vocal to give you an idea of what the final track will sound like. I have also re-recorded the drum track. As you can hear, this is a parody of "Tomorrow Never Knows" by the Beatles, which happens to be my favourite track of theirs.

item.title: RC50-2 - 29 July 2006
item.description: This is the second live improvised track I recorded using a Boss RC-50 looping pedal. This is more of a sketch than anything serious and is a good demonstration of how I come up with guitar solos. I usually work them out like this and then refine them over time. However, this example has all the mistakes left in and a little bit of distortion too. Enjoy!
item.author: mail@darrenlock.com

item.title: 07-07-06 - 07 July 2006
item.description: A live improvised guitar soundscape to commemorate the 07 July 2005 London Bombings. My thoughts are with those who lost their loved ones on that day. May liberty and freedom overcome the politics of fear and the religion of hate. Peace.
item.author: mail@darrenlock.com

item.title: Guitarscape 2 - Originally recorded on 26 October 2005
item.description: The concept behind the recording of this track is an interesting exercise in creating random music and discovering patterns instinctively. Using a Boss RC-20XL, I created a silent loop of about 30 seconds and began to play a single note, building up notes on the repeated loop until random themes begin to form. I particularly like the bell-like chime of the guitar. But the question always remains: is this music? Whatever it is, I personally find it very relaxing and think of it as a truly subconscious creation. Enjoy!
item.author: mail@darrenlock.com
item.source: You Are Allowed to Enjoy This...The PODCAST!

item.title: The Ashbory Bass - Video Podcast 05 March 2006
item.description:
Here is a short video podcast about the Ashbory bass, an instrument that features silicon rubber strings. During this podcast, I give a brief overview of the instrument and demonstrate its sound by playing my song "Adam and Eve".

For more information about my Ashbory bass, visit:

http://www.darrenlock.com/mt/archives/2005/08/my_ashbory_bass_1.html
